title: China Textile Mogul Pushed Into Fashion, Then Ran Into Trouble
sub_head: Qiu Yafu’s company acquired brands such as Savile Row’s Gieves & Hawkes that are now part of a liquidation process in Hong Kong
body:
Chinese textile magnate Qiu Yafu spent years buying up luxury fashion labels, saying he wanted to build a rival to LVMH Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton SE .
That ambition is now faltering, embroiling iconic brands he snapped up along the way, including Paris fashion house Cerruti 1881 and London’s Gieves & Hawkes, the Savile Row tailor that has dressed British royalty for more than 200 years.
